channel.title: Ventrilo
channel.description:
[b]I won't use Teamspeak or any other voice conferencing system.[/b]
Alright, I'm having issues with running vent under Wine on ubuntu - I also had the same issue on FC and arch.
I can connect to a server and listen fine, push-to-talk keys work fine aswell. When I go to speak, my voice is extremely scratchy, the stange thing is, this only occurs when using ALSA, when using OSS it works perfectly, but no other application can make any sound.
I've tried AOSS to try make it work, but it didn't help. Anyway, what I want help with is getting vent to run "perfectly" under wine with ALSA.

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @JukuG JukuG
item.description:
@JukuG wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:172615”]I just installed it and it works great using ALSA and my crappy built-in laptop microphone. Also TTS works as well. I simply followed the HOWTO here:

http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=version&iId=9832

Make sure you are using the latest WINE not from the ubuntu repositories but from the wine devs themselves, instructions for setting that up are here:

http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb

Let me know how it goes :)[/quote]

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

juju:

Well, OSS being the old, outdated thing that it is, blocks sound output from any other application - so, for example, I can’t use vent and listen to music at the same time.

Your OSS is not setup properly.

There are software mixers available for OSS, just as there are for ALSA.

Read full topic

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just installed it and it works great using ALSA and my crappy built-in laptop microphone. Also TTS works as well. I simply followed the HOWTO here:

http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=version&iId=9832

Make sure you are using the latest WINE not from the ubuntu repositories but from the wine devs themselves, instructions for setting that up are here:

http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb

Let me know how it goes

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve actually never tried it, I’ll give it a shot in the next day or so and see what happens. Just out of curiosity, if it runs perfectly with OSS why not just use it?

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“Rajae, post:2, topic:172615”]Well, unfortunately, wine can’t do everything.
You’ll just have to wait for the linux version of ventrilo to run it.[/quote]

I know of people who run vent fine under wine, they have not had this issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

I won’t use Teamspeak or any other voice conferencing system.

Alright, I’m having issues with running vent under Wine on ubuntu - I also had the same issue on FC and arch.

I can connect to a server and listen fine, push-to-talk keys work fine aswell. When I go to speak, my voice is extremely scratchy, the stange thing is, this only occurs when using ALSA, when using OSS it works perfectly, but no other application can make any sound.

I’ve tried AOSS to try make it work, but it didn’t help. Anyway, what I want help with is getting vent to run “perfectly” under wine with ALSA.
